channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: President Trump says he will not watch American football or any national soccer sides if players do not stand for the national anthem.
item.title: 'I won't be watching much': Trump refuses to watch football if players kneel

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A construction union has hit out at Kate Jones, claiming she has failed to deliver on thousands of local jobs promised for Queensland's biggest infrastructure project.
item.title: Union claims Kate Jones has failed to deliver jobs on Cross River Rail

item.description: The car rental firm looking to cash in on a huge speculative rise in its share price since filing for bankruptcy with an unusual and possibly unprecedented move.
item.title: Bankrupt car giant Hertz wins approval to offer 'potentially worthless' shares

item.description: There had been almost no new coronavirus cases in the city for almost two months until an infection was reported on June 12.
item.title: Fears of a second wave as Beijing steps up coronavirus measures

item.description: Countries including France and Germany are opening their borders to each other, but the rest of the world will need to wait.
item.title: European countries open their borders and step into a brave new world

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The chief executive of private equity fund LeapFrog has said emerging markets present challenges and opportunities during COVID-19.
item.title: How tech and demographics could save emerging markets investors

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: NSW government and Parramatta City Council are at loggerheads over who should fund renovations to the Riverside Theatres.
item.title: Costing dispute throws Powerhouse-Riverside Theatre deal in doubt

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Men have spent an average of $290 more on gambling than normal in the fortnight after receiving a super withdrawal payment
item.title: Sex and super: how men spend their nest-egg withdrawals differently to women

item.description: The effects of colonialist murder, dispossession and the theft of children are still echoing down through the generations
item.title: Targeting police will do little to stop Aboriginal deaths in custody

item.description: It was the height of the great toilet paper crisis of 2020 and rumours were flying through the leafy streets of Lane Cove. It didn't take long for them to reach Jacky Barker.
item.title: Toilet paper crisis shows value of citizen journalism

item.description: Many actions taken, opinions expressed and stories told in times past express views with which we would not seek to align ourselves today.
item.title: For our future's sake, we must note the sins of our past

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Fifty-eight children were among the 1018 people fined during the coronavirus crackdown, documents reveal.
item.title: COVID-19 fines in NSW alone totalled more than $1 million

item.description: Statues are often invisible to most of us, even when we walk past them every day. But in the past week they have been swept up in a wave of unrest as we have questioned our history and who we are.
item.title: Transform statues to make us question the past

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The players have been confined to their homes for four months, but that's about to come to an end.
item.title: Bursting the bubble: NRL set to free players and staff from isolation

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: While CA prepares to announce redundancies, the future of CA's chief executive is also becoming increasingly uncertain.
item.title: Pressure builds on Roberts as axe ready to fall on Cricket Australia staff

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: All businesses, including cinemas, theatres, theme parks and strip clubs, can reopen. Only nightclubs will remain closed.
item.title: 'Game changer': Berejiklian opens up state from July 1, with one exception

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: The Jewish Museum of Australia will hold its first exhibition on beloved artist Mirka Mora later this year.
item.title: Mirka's message through art: to recognise humanity in one other

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Energy Minister Angus Taylor is looking to develop domestic storage facilities to secure Australia's oil supply.
item.title: Government takes unprecedented steps to build emergency fuel reserves

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Fewer than one in 10 voters say an insufficient response to the crisis from governments is among their top concerns, a survey has found.
item.title: Voters happy with how Australian governments have dealt with pandemic

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The Queensland government is considering whether it is legally and logistically possible to create a travel bubble with neighbouring NSW.
item.title: Queensland investigating 'travel bubble' with NSW

item.description: While Facebook can’t solve all the financial challenges faced by the news industry, It can help news organisations build sustainable digital business models.
item.title: Media rules must help news providers harness digital platforms' value

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The NRL's new deal with Foxtel has put a stop to free streaming for Telstra customers and put a hole in the telco's limited media strategy.
item.title: Cracks widen in Telstra's 'bits and pieces' media strategy after NRL snub

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: There are more ways than one for Scott Morrison still to stuff up the virus crisis and he would do well to remember a key rule: don’t believe your own bulldust.
item.title: Morrison's report: high marks so far, but now the hard part

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Optus is expecting large consumer uptake when the English Premier League returns this week.
item.title: Optus eyes Premier League boost as pandemic waylays plans

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: All eyes will be on Deb Frecklington when Parliament returns this week as a war erupts between the Opposition Leader and her party's headquarters after internal polling was leaked at the weekend.
item.title: The LNP is at war over the one man Labor fears

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The group buying the newswire intends to put millions into the business until it becomes profitable.
item.title: Australian Associated Press to be sold for $1

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Private health insurers say Australians will be thinking hard about value of policies post-pandemic.
item.title: Health funds race to boost value for young people post-pandemic

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The beep-beep of reversing trucks at dawn and earlier is 'hell' for many Potts Point residents.
item.title: Noise fears as 24-hour supermarket deliveries slated to stay

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The chair of Parliament's finance committee has warned Australia's financial institutions against backing new national security legislation.
item.title: Australian banks warned of 'serious brand damage' in Hong Kong

item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has seen Australian unions re-establish their place as legitimate partners in national policy debates.
item.title: Pandemic reunites a not-so-odd couple

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Startups are relying on the government's JobKeeper program to keep staff employed and are preparing for the $70 billion program to be rolled back.
item.title: Startups reliant on JobKeeper to stave off redundancies

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: US private equity firm Oaktree Capital offered to buy some of Seven West Media's debt, but chief executive James Warburton said no.
item.title: Seven boss turns away Oaktree Capital

item.description: Their slapstick routines had made Bud Abbott and Lou Costello huge stars, but they revealed another side to the Herald during their Sydney tour.
item.title: From the Archives, 1955: Those SERIOUS funny men, Abbott and Costello

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The Productivity Commission has proposed tighter regulation to help protect students from rorters in private colleges.
item.title: Vocational training loans would saddle many with a 'lifetime of debt'

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Apartment owners say continued costs arising from the cracks in the 36-storey tower at Sydney Olympic Park is putting them under financial stress.
item.title: 'Throwing good money after bad': Opal Tower owners struggle as costs mount

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Plans to build 3000 units in towers up to 32 storeys on part of the Waterloo public housing estate have raised concerns about later stages of the project.
item.title: Future of Waterloo's public housing towers unclear as revamp powers on

item.description: As restrictions ease, it's time for people to discover if their lockdown fling was the real deal.
item.title: New romances forged on apps are now being tested in the real world

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The culling season is well under way at News Corp - and the soccer reporters sure know about it.
item.title: Has football fallen afoul of News Corp powerbrokers?

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The Richard Branson-linked investment firm Cyrus Capital says it will rebirth Virgin as a mid-market airline that has both a domestic and international network.
item.title: Cyrus sees smaller, simpler Virgin profitable in three years

item.dc:creator: Amanda Vanstone
item.description: Erasing the past, however painful it may be to remember it, is a mistake that will leave future generations in ignorance.
item.title: Don't insult us by saying what we can and can't watch

item.description: Why should Lumumba go to Collingwood and pat the club on the back for making “progress” on racism after his mistreatment?
item.title: Collingwood must face up to Lumumba allegations

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: The Andrews government’s Wage Theft Bill includes hefty fines and up to 10 years jail for rogue employers with a team of new inspectors empowered to police the laws.
item.title: Australia's first wage theft laws set to pass in Victoria

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Forty kilometres of bike lane upgrades will be fast-tracked to meet a surge in the number of people cycling into Melbourne's CBD.
item.title: Hundreds of car parking spaces to go as city embraces cycling

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Public housing in Ascot Vale that could be home to hundreds is latest to face wrecking ball - but unlike other estates going, there are no plans to replace it.
item.title: Public housing in Ascot Vale to go, as demolition hots up across city

item.description: The day's burning issues as seen through the eyes of the Herald's cartoonists.
item.title: Editorial cartoon

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Shaun Carney
item.description: The government has put down the cudgels at least for the moment and is taking a tentative – that is the key word – step towards industrial relations policymaking.
item.title: As we prepare for recovery, we should ask what 'recovery' will mean

item.description: Mercifully, children reading her books today aren't privy to the slings and arrows of social media.
item.title: What a shame this row has stolen some of Potter magic

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 15, 2020

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Scientists warn the federal government’s key environment laws are failing to protect wildlife and ecosystems from climate change.
item.title: Climate change 'threat multiplier' ignored in national environment laws
